senses.sense_definition: An obsolete term for the letter <w>zed</w> (Z).

examples.text: In older dialects, children were taught to say <w>zad</w> at the end of the alphabet.
The spelling book from the nineteenth century lists <w>zad</w> as the name of the last character.

senses.sense_definition: A militant open-air demonstration or occupation, typically in the form of a defended squat to block a development project.

examples.text: Activists established a <w>ZAD</w> on the farmland to prevent the construction of the new airport.
Living in the <w>ZAD</w> requires a commitment to communal values and resistance.

senses.sense_definition: An alternative spelling of <w>daad</w>, a letter in the Arabic alphabet.

examples.text: The student practiced pronouncing the emphatic sound of the letter <w>zad</w>.
In this transliteration system, the author uses <w>zad</w> to represent the specific Arabic consonant.
